page.title: 10Schools
page.content: The first school in Fochriw was in the Methodist Chapel building in Guest Street. Later there was a school next to the building which is still called School House.The present Infant School was built in 1904,the Junior Dept.in 1909. They were both made of local stone,red brick,timber and Welsh slate from the quarries of North Wales.All the slate came by railway.In this year of 1985 there are six classes in our school.Two of them are in the Infants and four in the Juniors.There are six teachers and one Headmaster teaching 144 children.In 1977 there were 250 children taught by 10 teachers.In the village we also have a Nursery School.The Playschool is held in the Community Centre.All children in the district attend Rhymney Comprehensive School.
